column4: I have a very big complain, and i have complained before as well, but was unable to get a response then, if i can't get a response in the channel i would like to know from who or where. The question is as follows: Every since switching from Hoary to Breezy, certain application seem to close on their own, a very important application to me which i know for a fact closesly randomly, becasue of ubuntu breezy is xcha
t, i have lost many hours of works and filequeues because my xchat closes because breezy has porblems
I have experienced the same thing with xchat a few times.  I am now running it in a terminal to see if I can find an error message, but it has yet to crash.
I have only noticed this behavior with xchat, what other programs crashed for you?

if i leave firefox running, i wake up firefox is no longer running, and Xchat is not running as usual, sometimes xchat closes in front of my eyes, and i just feel like stomping on which ever idiot that made the error int he ubuntu code, i tried with the ubuntu repop, xchat 2.4.4 and then complied my self xchat 2.4.5
the one you compiled has not crashed I assume?
did you do a upgrade to breezy using the repositories, from hoary to breezy
i had that problem, give me a sec and ill write up the fix
back up your current gmd.conf and replace it with factory-gdm.conf... everything should be in /etc/gdm
sudo cp gdm.conf gdm.conf.backup and then sudo cp factory-gdm.conf gdm.conf
did exactly as u mentined and didn't work
still giving you an error about gdm.conf?
link your gdm.conf again... and does the erro give you a line number?
I assumed it was the same problem because I thought it said gdm.conf... it amy be a different file
make sure you undo the factory replace and put back the backup
when he gets back can to please let em know for me that i appreciated his help
